name: Noah Snavely [Tech]
content: Noah Snavely—Cornell Computer Science, Cornell Tech Postdocs Yuanbo Xiangli Ph.D. Students Yen-Yu Chang Hanyu Chen Gene Chou Haian Jin Bharath Raj Nagoor Kani Alumni Ruojin Cai (postdoc, Kempner Institute) Qianqian Wang (postdoc, Berkeley) Wenqi Xian (Netflix Research) Kai Zhang (Adobe) Hadar Averbuch-Elor (Cornell Tech) Jin Sun (University of Georgia) Zhengqi Li (Google Research) Paul Upchurch (Apple) Scott Wehrwein (Western Washington University) Balazs Kovacs (Zoox) Sean Bell (Grokstyle) Kevin Matzen (Facebook) Kyle Wilson (Washington College) Daniel Hauagge (Cornell Tech) Song Cao (Amazon) Chun-Po Wang (Google) Teaching Spring '25CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '24CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '23CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '22CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '21CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '20CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '19CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '18CS5670: Computer Vision Spring '17CS5670: Computer Vision Summer '15CURIE Academy Fall '13CS4670/5670: Intro to Computer Vision Spring '13CS1114: Intro to Computing using Matlab and Robotics About me Noah is a Professor of Computer Science at Cornell Tech interested in computer vision and computer graphics, and a member of the Cornell Graphics and Vision Group. He also works at Google DeepMind in NYC. His research interests are in computer vision and graphics, in particular in 3D understanding and depiction of scenes from images. Noah is the recipient of a PECASE, a Microsoft New Faculty Fellowship, an Alfred P. Sloan Fellowship, and a SIGGRAPH Significant New Researcher Award, and is a Fellow of the ACM and the IEEE. For a quick overview of my interests, see my TR35 talk. View my CV. Publications See my Google Scholar page.
